intro: Ohashia yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan ohashia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant typically features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in the spring. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, providing a striking contrast to the delicate flowers. Ohashia yunnanensis is often found in humid, well-drained soils at higher elevations, where it thrives in partial shade.
